column4: I am a new Ubuntu user and I am having problems ejecting a CD. I have pressed the eject button on the drive, I have right-clicked the cd-rom desktop item and chosen "eject", I have run the "eject" command, all to no avail. any help?
try sudo eject
sudo eject does nothing
any error messages?
no error messages at all
weird.. it might be faster to just reboot and take out the cd then, but that won't show you why it's not ejecting.
this is true, however I am currently downloading a big Ubuntu update and I was hoping to get some stuff done while I wait :)
run dmesg | tail and see if there's any errors in there
type mount and see where it's mounted
dmesg shows a few errors that may have something to do with it, would you like me to paste them?
the run sudo umount /media/mountpoint and that should give you more feedback.
sure - pastebin
http://pastebin.com/d407d05c2
do you only have one hard drive?
there are 2 hard drives, though I am not sure if the second is mounted
just mount
if you pipe it to grep you might miss it
well I tried just mount, and it doesnt show anything that looks like a cd drive
those errors from your pastebin is cdrom errors afaik
Here is the output from mount, if its of any use: http://pastebin.com/dc45004b
yeah it's not mounted and must be hdb then. i'm not sure if eject has a force option. seems like you will have to wait until you reboot
well OK then, I have about 20 minutes to wait for this upgrade, I will get the CD out then, thanks anyway
np
